alert.note: Alert for Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 10:58AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN UNION COUNTY THROUGH 1130 AM MDT... At 1057 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Des Moines, moving northeast at 40 mph. Another strong storm was located northeast of Des Moines. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Des Moines. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 381 and 398. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.

area.areaDesc: Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County
